```{r }
# Import libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(kableExtra)

# Import data
data <- read.csv("C:/Users/evely/OneDrive/Documents/DS 4002 - Data Science Project/MI3-Project-3/DATA/results.csv")
data



# Convert camouflaged and match columns to logical
data$camouflaged <- as.logical(data$camouflaged)
data$match <- as.logical(data$match)


# Create accuracy table
camoObjects <- data$object_detected[data$camouflaged == TRUE]
camoObjectDetectedTrue <- sum(camoObjects == "True")

camoMatch <- data$match[data$camouflaged == TRUE]
camoMatchTrue <- sum(camoMatch == TRUE)

nonCamoObjects <- data$object_detected[data$camouflaged == FALSE]
nonCamoObjectDetectedTrue <- sum(nonCamoObjects == "True")

nonCamoMatch <- data$match[data$camouflaged == FALSE]
nonCamoMatchTrue <- sum(nonCamoMatch == TRUE)

# Summary table
summary_table <- data.frame(
  Camouflaged = c("True", "False"),
  Object_Detection_Accuracy = c(camoObjectDetectedTrue/83,
                               nonCamoObjectDetectedTrue/83),
  Object_Match_Accuracy = c(camoMatchTrue/83,
                            nonCamoMatchTrue/83)
)

# Print summary table
kable(summary_table, align = "c", caption = "Summary Table of Object Detection and Match Accuracy") %>%
  kable_styling(full_width = FALSE)

counts_table <- data.frame(
  Camouflaged = c("True", "False"),
  Object_Detected = c(camoObjectDetectedTrue, nonCamoObjectDetectedTrue),
  Object_Match = c(camoMatchTrue, nonCamoMatchTrue)
)

# Create table for number of objects detected
ggplot(data, aes(x = object_detected, fill = camouflaged)) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Number of Objects Detected by Camouflaged",
       x = "Object Detected",
       y = "Number of Object Detections",
       fill = "Camouflaged") +
  theme_minimal()

# Create table for number of objects detected correctly
ggplot(data, aes(x = match, fill = camouflaged)) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Number of Objects Detected Correctly by Camouflaged",
       x = "Object Detected",
       y = "Number of Object Label Matches",
       fill = "Camouflaged") +
  theme_minimal()
```
